009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016
017/**
018 * Vector version.
019 * This class implements a 5x5 Nagao-Matsuyama filter, as described in
020 * NagaoMatsuyama (1979).
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2021/01/02
024 */
025
026public class NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements NagaoMatsuyamaF {
027
028        // uses the same subregions as defined in {@link NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar}
029        
030        private final float varThreshold;
031        private float minVariance;
032        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
033        private final float[] minMean = new float[3];
034        
035        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector() {
036                this(new Parameters());
037        }
038        
039        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
040                this.varThreshold = (float) params.varThreshold;
041        }
042        
043        // ------------------------------------------------------
044        
045        @Override
046        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
047                minVariance = Float.MAX_VALUE;
048                evalSubregionColor(pack, Constants.R0, u, v);
049                minVariance = minVariance - 3 * varThreshold;
050                for (int[][] Rk : Constants.SubRegions) {
051                        evalSubregionColor(pack, Rk, u, v);
052                }
053                this.copyPixel(minMean, rgb);
054                return rgb;
055        }
056        
057        void evalSubregionColor(PixelPack ia, int[][] R, int u, int v) {
058                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
059                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
060                int n = 0;
061                for (int[] p : R) {
062                        final float[] cp = ia.getVec(u + p[0], v + p[1]);
063                        
064                        S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
065                        S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
066                        S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
067                        
068                        S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
069                        S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
070                        S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
071                        
072                        n = n + 1;              // pixel count in subregion
073                }
074                // calculate variance for this subregion:
075                float var0 = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) / n) / n;      // variance red
076                float var1 = (S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) / n) / n;      // variance green
077                float var2 = (S2[2] - sqr(S1[2]) / n) / n;      // variance blue
078                // total variance:
079                float totalVar = var0 + var1 + var2;    
080                if (totalVar < minVariance) {
081                        minVariance = totalVar;
082                        minMean[0] = S1[0] / n;
083                        minMean[1] = S1[1] / n;
084                        minMean[2] = S1[2] / n;
085                }
086        }
087
088}
